content.webTitle: Record profit bolsters BOC takeover defences

fields.headline: Record profit bolsters BOC takeover defences
fields.bodyText: BOC yesterday strengthened its defences against any further takeover approach from Germany's Linde by reporting record first-quarter profits. A three-year programme of job cuts and restructuring at the gases group allowed it to make £128.8m before tax in the three months to the end of December on revenues up 4% at £1.22bn. The company has rejected the £7.6bn offer from Linde and refused to say more about it yesterday. "We continue to be confident that the group's current strategy will deliver growth and excellent returns to our shareholders," said the chief executive, Tony Isaac.
